item.title: Cronos: The New Dawn ‘Sector A-0’ gameplay
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Explore environments where the laws of physics have completely broken down.

Bloober Team has released a 10-minute “gameplay showcase” trailer for third-person survival horror game Cronos: The New Dawn dubbed “Sector A-0.”

Here is an overview of the game, via Bloober Team:

About

Cronos: The New Dawn delivers a haunting journey through time and terror. Set in two eras—the decaying future and 1980s Poland—players are plunged into a world inspired by the real Krakow district—Nowa Huta, where survival means bending time itself. You play as a Traveler, an agent of the mysterious Collective, emerging from a dystopian future to dive back into time and extract people before they perish in the apocalypse. As you explore a world on the brink of annihilation, you’ll encounter grotesque enemies known as the Orphans.

Don’t Let Them Merge

The new gameplay trailer reveals intense survival moments inside the Orphans’ nest, offering a closer look at these terrifying creatures. Orphans are twisted, body-horror monstrosities born from humanity’s darkest nightmares. The trailer showcases their behavior—exceptionally aggressive and relentless—turning every encounter into a desperate fight for survival. Most importantly, players must prevent them from merging. As previously shown, defeated enemies must be burned immediately. If not, they risk being absorbed by other foes, triggering a merge that creates an even stronger and faster enemy.

Exploring the Twisted Realms of the New Dawn

Additionally, the exciting new trailer reveals part of the story of a mysterious Predecessor—Traveler ND 3500—and their cryptic travel log. Players will journey through unsettling post-apocalyptic environments inspired by the existing Polish district—Nowa Huta, where decaying Brutalist architecture is warped and twisted by reality-bending anomalies.

Cronos: The New Dawn is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store this fall.

item.title: The Outer Worlds 2 priced dropped to $69.99
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

No longer launching at $79.99.

The Outer Worlds 2 will cost $69.99 instead of its previously announced $79.99 when it launches for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on October 29, publisher Xbox Game Studios and developer Obsidian Entertainment announced.

“We’re focused on bringing players incredible worlds to explore, and will keep our full priced holiday releases, including The Outer Worlds 2, at $69.99—in line with current market conditions,” an Xbox representative told Windows Central in regards to the decision.

item.title: Silent Hill: Townfall developer No Code rebrands to Screen Burn Interactive
item.content:encoded:
A new era for the Glasgow-based studio.

No Code, the studio behind Stories Untold, Observation, and the upcoming Silent Hill: Townfall, has rebranded under the new name Screen Burn Interactive, the studio announced.

“We’re not who we were in 2015,” said Screen Burn Interactive founder and creative director Jon McKellan, referring to the company’s two-person start in Glasgow, Scotland. “We’ve grown and changed. For a start, we have coders now! So, we needed a name that instead reflects what’s always been at the heart of the games themselves: the imperfect feel of old technology and the lasting impact of a story that stays with you long after the credits roll.”

Screen Burn Interactive aims to capture that spirit, comparing “the ghost of an image burned into an old CRT screen,” to the memory of a game forever imprinted on your mind.

Development on Silent Hill: Townfall remains underway with Konami and Annapurna Interactive. Further information will be announced at a later date.
